qas.question: Which candidate, after dropping out, went on to endorse Kerry?
Which troubled candidate did Carol Moseley Braun end up endorsing, after she dropped out?
The continual playing of Dean's post-rally speech by the media stirred what type of controversy?

answers.text: whether Dean was the victim of media bias

qas.question: What tag did the media attach to Dean's post-rally speech?
Did those in attendance at Dean's speech know about the "Dean Scream"?
Where did Carol Moseley Braun give a speech that hurt her campaign?
What was Braun thought to be a victim of by the media?
How many times were their news reports that focused on negative events in Braun's campaign?
What place in the race was Braun?
What was filtering the crowd noise when Braun was giving a speech?

context: The dismal results caused <a0_0>Gephardt<a0_0/> to drop out and later endorse Kerry. Carol Moseley Braun also dropped out, endorsing <a1_0>Howard Dean<a1_0/>. Besides the impact of coming in <b8_0>third<b8_0/>, Dean was further hurt by a speech he gave <b5_0>at a post-caucus rally<b5_0/>. Dean was shouting over the cheers of his enthusiastic audience, but the crowd noise was being filtered out by his <b9_0>unidirectional microphone<b9_0/>, leaving only his full-throated exhortations audible to the television viewers. To those at home, he seemed to raise his voice out of sheer emotion. The incessant replaying of the <a3_0>"Dean Scream"<a3_0/> by the press became a debate on the topic of <a2_0>whether Dean was the victim of media <b6_0>bias<b6_0/><a2_0/>. The scream scene was shown approximately <b7_0>633<b7_0/> times by cable and broadcast news networks in just four days following the incident, a number that does not include talk shows and local news broadcasts. However, those who were in the actual audience that day insist that <a4_0>they were not aware<a4_0/> of the infamous "scream" until they returned to their hotel rooms and saw it on TV.
